description.en: (1) Give students experience in argumenting about their research topic and presenting research results; (2) deepen their knowledge in measurement and analysis methods, metrology and quality systems and (3) help them in planning their career.
description.et: (1) Annab tudengitele kogemuse oma teadustöö korrektsest esitamisest nii artiklitena kui ettekannetena; (2) süvendab mõõte- ja analüüsimeetodite, metroloogia ja kvaliteedisüsteemide alaseid teadmisi ja (3) aitab tudengit karjääri planeerimisel.

objectives.en: The aims of the course are: (1) to give students experience in argumenting about their research topic and presenting research results; (2) deepen their knowledge in measurement and analysis methods, metrology and quality systems and (3) help them in planning their career.
objectives.et: Käeoleva kursuse eesmärkideks on (1) anda tudengitele kogemus oma teadustöö korrektsest esitamisest nii artiklitena kui ettekannetena; (2) süvendada mõõte- ja analüüsimeetodite, metroloogia ja kvaliteedisüsteemide alaseid teadmisi ja (3) aidata tudengit karjääri planeerimisel.

description.et: All students who have (1) participated in at least 75% of the seminars; (2) have participated in the group work; (3) have made a presentation at the end of the semester (either on a literature source or on the topic of his/her master thesis) and successfully defended it are considered as successfully passed the course.

grade_preconditions.et: All students who have (1) participated in at least 75% of the seminars; (2) have participated in the group work; (3) have made a presentation at the end of the semester (either on a literature source or on the topic of his/her master thesis) and successfully defended it are admitted to the evaluation.

grade_evaluation.et: All students who have (1) participated in at least 75% of the seminars; (2) have participated in the group work; (3) have made a presentation at the end of the semester (either on a literature source or on the topic of his/her master thesis) and successfully defended it are assigned the grade "pass".

debt_elimination.et: Depending on the situation the student has to do one or more of the following (will be decided together with the teacher): (1) make and defend an additional presentation; (2) work with a literature source and answer questions about it.

resources.mandatory_materials: The study materials of the course are available in Study Information System under "Study materials"
resources.recommended_materials:
1.	Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement; BIPM, IEC, IFCC, ISO, IUPAC, IUPAP, OIML; ISO: Geneva, 1995.
2.	Quantifying Uncertainty in Analytical Measurement, 2nd ed.; Ellison, S. L. R.; Rösslein, M.; Williams, A., Eds.; EURACHEM/CITAC, 2000. (available at: http://www.eurachem.ul.pt/)
3.	Nordtest Report TR 537. Handbook for Calculation of Measurement Uncertainty in Environmental Laboratories. B. Magnusson, T. Näykki, H. Hovind, M. Krysell. Nordtest, 2004 (available at: http://www.nordtest.org/)
4.	TrainMiC - Training in Metrology in Chemistry. Piotr Robouch, Ewa Bulska, Steluta Duta, Margreet Lauwaars, Ivo Leito, Nineta Majcen, Jørgen Norgaard, Miloslav Suchanek, Emilia Vassileva and Philip Taylor (project leader). EUR 20841 EN, EC Directorate General JRC-IRMM, 2003. (available at: http://tera.chem.ut.ee/~ivo/metro/TrainMiC-EU-Rep.pdf)
5.	The Fitness for Purpose of Analytical Methods. A Laboratory Guide to Method Validation and Related Topics. EURACHEM, LGC, Teddington, 1998. (available at: http://www.eurachem.ul.pt/)
6.	Traceability in Chemical Measurement. EURACHEM, 2003. (available at: http://www.eurachem.ul.pt/)
7.	Quality Assurance in Analytical Chemistry - Training and Teaching. Wenclawiak, B., Koch, M., and Hadjicostas, E. (eds.). Springer, Berlin, Heidelberg, 2003.
8.	Quality in the Food Analysis Laboratory. R. Wood, A. Nilsson, H. Wallin; RSC, Cambridge, 1998.
